subject: English
title: Descriptive Writing Techniques
description: Master the art of creating vivid descriptions in your writing

content.text: Descriptive writing brings your stories to life by helping readers see, hear, smell, taste, and feel what you're describing.

content.heading: The Five Senses
content.text: Great descriptive writing engages all five senses: sight, sound, smell, taste, and touch. This creates a more immersive experience for your readers.

content.heading: Weak vs Strong Description
solution: Strong: The garden burst with color as roses climbed the weathered stone wall, their sweet fragrance mingling with the earthy scent of fresh soil.
Notice how the strong version uses specific details and sensory language

content.heading: Show, Don't Tell
content.text: Instead of telling readers how something is, show them through specific details and actions.

content.heading: Writing Exercise
problems: Describe a busy marketplace using at least three senses
Rewrite this: 'She was nervous' - Show her nervousness through actions and details
Describe your favorite food without naming it, using sensory details
